actions.recommendation: PSA testing: annually, from age 40: if one first-degree relative who had prostate cancer at <65yrs or female relatives diagnosed with BRCA1 or BRCA2 gene mutation breast cancer. BMI doesn't account for body composition, which means it misses the difference between muscle mass and fat because muscles are more dense and heavier than fat

ECG: Normal sinus rhythm, ventricular extrasystoles. Extrasystoles can occur frequently in people with completely normal hearts and often do not cause any problems. Discuss this further with your family doctor.
